metadata.name: Certificate Exported Via PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detects calls to cmdlets that are used to export certificates from the local certificate store. Threat actors were seen abusing this to steal private keys from compromised machines.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('export-pfxcertificate ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('export-certificate '))))

output.summary: Detects calls to cmdlets that are used to export certificates from the local certificate store. Threat actors were seen abusing this to steal private keys from compromised machines.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate certificate exports by administrators. Additional filters might be required. References: https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ncas/analysis-reports/ar21-112a, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/pki/export-pfxcertificate?view=windowsserver2022-ps, https://www.splunk.com/en_us/blog/security/breaking-the-chain-defending-against-certificate-services-abuse.html
